alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Durham; Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Orange; Person; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alamance, southern Person, Vance, Warren, Orange, Granville, northwestern Halifax, northern Durham and northern Franklin Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Norlina to near Oxford to Graham. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Durham, Burlington, Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Graham, Oxford, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Warrenton and Mebane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds may occur well ahead of any rain or lightning. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Alamance; Durham; Franklin; Granville; Halifax; Orange; Person; Vance; Warren
